body_html:
@gaurav5670 First off, did you confirm that the following file to confirm the code-mismatch issue?

/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/models/rnn/translate/seq2seq_model.py

If this is indeed the problem, it seems to me that you can set PYTHONPATH as follows:

# 1) Try this first
export PYTHONPATH=/path/to/your/sources:$PYTHONPATH

# 2) If the above doesn't work, try setting dist-packages explicitly, *after* your sources.
export PYTHONPATH=/path/to/your/sources:/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages:$PYTHONPATH

With (1) we're telling python to first resolve imports from your sources, falling back on whatever your original PYTHONPATH was set to. With (2) we're telling python to first resolve from your sources, then from dist-packages, and finally from whatever your original PYTHONPATH was set to.

We're basically trying to set things up so that your sources take precedence over everything else.

body:
@gaurav5670 First off, did you confirm that the following file to confirm the code-mismatch issue?

```
/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/models/rnn/translate/seq2seq_model.py
```

If this is indeed the problem, it seems to me that you can set PYTHONPATH as follows:

```
# 1) Try this first
export PYTHONPATH=/path/to/your/sources:$PYTHONPATH

# 2) If the above doesn't work, try setting dist-packages explicitly, *after* your sources.
export PYTHONPATH=/path/to/your/sources:/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages:$PYTHONPATH
```

With (1) we're telling python to first resolve imports from your sources, falling back on whatever your original PYTHONPATH was set to.  With (2) we're telling python to first resolve from your sources, then from dist-packages, and finally from whatever your original PYTHONPATH was set to.

We're basically trying to set things up so that your sources take precedence over everything else.
